author: The Current
description:
Dave Pirner and Jeremy Tappero of Soul Asylum talk music promotion
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

During a recent interview with host Mac Wilson in The Current studio, Minneapolis band Soul Asylum — with a career that reaches across decades — pondered the question of promoting music then and now. "I still don't know [how]," Dave Pirner says. 

Musicians
David Pirner - Lead Singer 
Ryan Smith - Lead Guitar
Jeremy Tappero - Bass Player

Credits
Guests – @SoulAsylum 
Host – Mac Wilson
Producer – Derrick Stevens
Video – Eric Xu Romani, Will Keeler
Audio – Evan Clark
Graphics – Natalia Toledo
Digital Producer – Luke Taylor

description:

Check out the full session on our Youtube page.

title: Dessa performs "Tough Call" in studio

author: The Current
description:
Watch Dessa perform "Camelot" in studio
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Minneapolis multi-hyphenate artist Dessa visited The Current to play a pair of new songs for 2025 — "Camelot" and "Tough Call" — and a song from her 2023 album, "Bury The Lede. Watch a performance of "Camelot" above.

Musicians
Dessa – vocals
Aby Wolf – vocals
Aviva Jaye – vocals, harp
Joshua Williams – music director, vocals, tracks, keys, sax
Cameron Kinghorn – vocals
Matthew Santos – vocals

author: The Current
description:
Watch Ratboys performing "Anywere," recorded live in Minneapolis
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Chicago indie-rock band Ratboys performed an intimate MicroShow at Cloudland Theater in Minneapolis on Tuesday, Nov. 18, 2025. The setlist included five songs from the forthcoming album, "Singin’ to an Empty Chair," expected February 6, 2026, on New West Records — including this song, "Anywhere." Turn it up! 

Concert attendees consisted of lucky winners who entered for a chance to win passes to the show. This Microshow event was supported by @voodoorangerIPA.

Musicians
Julia Steiner – vocals, guitar
David Sagan – guitar
Sean Neumann – bass, vocals
Marcus Nuccio – drums

Credits
Guests – @ratboys 
Producers – Lindsay Kimball, David Safar
Video – Evan Clark
Audio – Eric Xu Romani
Graphics – Natalia Toledo
Digital Producer – Luke Taylor

Subscribe to our channel:

title: Ratboys rock out on "Anywhere" at The Current's Microshow in Minneapolis

author: The Current
description:
Watch a Microshow concert by Ratboys, recorded live in Minneapolis
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Chicago indie-rock band Ratboys performed an intimate MicroShow at Cloudland Theater in Minneapolis on Tuesday, Nov. 18, 2025. The show came not long after the release of the band’s latest single, “Light Night Mountains All That,” which dropped in September — an advance single coming ahead of the band’s next album, Singin’ to an Empty Chair, expected February 6, 2026, on New West Records. Ratboys’ eight-song set at Cloudland included five songs from the forthcoming album.

Concert attendees consisted of lucky winners who entered for a chance to win passes to the show. This Microshow event was supported by @voodoorangerIPA. Watch video of the performance above.

Songs Performed
00:00:00 The Window
00:04:12 Anywhere
00:07:17 Penny In The Lake
00:12:08 What's Right?
00:17:45 I Go Out at Night
00:21:21 Light Night Mountains All That
00:27:15 The
title: Ratboys perform a Microshow set at Cloudland Theater in Minneapolis for The Current
